item.title: Basic Identification- What are the x-intercept and y-intercept of the line 2x + 3y = 6?
item.description:
(6-2x)/3

To find the x-intercept and y-intercept of the line given by the equation \(2x + 3y = 6\), follow these steps:

Step 1: Understanding Intercepts #

  • The y-intercept is the point where the graph crosses the y-axis. At this point, the value of \(x\) is 0.
  • The x-intercept is the point where the graph crosses the x-axis. At this point, the value of \(y\) is 0.

Step 2: Finding the Y-Intercept #

  1. \[ 2(0) + 3y = 6 \]
  2. \[ 0 + 3y = 6 \]\[ 3y = 6 \]
  3. \[ y = \frac{6}{3} = 2 \]

  4. Conclusion: The y-intercept is at the point \((0, 2)\).

item.title: Prove the AM-GM inequality for two positive numbers
item.description:
Step-by-Step Proof of AM-GM Inequality for Two Positive Numbers

To prove the Arithmetic Mean-Geometric Mean (AM-GM) inequality for two positive numbers \( a \) and \( b \), we follow these steps:

  1. \[ \frac{a + b}{2} \geq \sqrt{ab} \]

    Equality holds if and only if \( a = b \).

  2. \[ \text{AM} = \frac{a + b}{2} \]
  3. \[ a + b \geq 2\sqrt{ab} \]
  4. \[ (a + b - 2\sqrt{ab}) \geq 0 \]
  5. \[ (\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b})^2 = a - 2\sqrt{ab} + b \]\[ (\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b})^2 \geq 0 \]
  6. \[ (\sqrt{a} - \sqrt{b})^2 \geq 0 \]\[ a + b \geq 2\sqrt{ab} \]
